intro: Osmoxylon trilobatum, commonly known as the three-lobed osmoxylon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Its bark is thick and fibrous, containing compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Osmoxylon trilobatum is often found in tropical lowland forests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
